tp:taxon-treatment.tp:nomenclature:
Stoyanowites parallelus Korn & Hairapetian
sp. nov.

tp:treatment-sec.p:
Species of
Stoyanowites
with conch reaching 100 mm dm. Subadult stage with rectangular, compressed whorl profile (ww/wh =0.70), subangular ventrolateral shoulder and flattened venter; 10 rather coarse ventrolateral spines per half volution. Adult stage with parallel-sided, compressed whorl profile (ww/ wh= 0.60), flat venter and angular ventrolateral shoulder; 15 ventrolateral spines per half volution. Prongs of external lobe simple; altogether 13 notches of E, A and L lobes.
Named after the parallel flanks of the whorl profile.
Holotype IRAN • Esfahan Province , Baghuk Mountain C section ; Hambast Formation , 1.70 m below the top; illustrated in Fig. 63A ; MB.C.30102 .

Paratypes IRAN • 2 specimens ; Esfahan Province , Baghuk Mountain E section ; Hambast Formation ; MB.C.30103 to MB.C.30104
•
1 specimen ; Esfahan Province , Baghuk Mountain G section ; Hambast Formation ; MB.C.30105
.

Holotype MB.C.30102 is an incomplete specimen of 72 mm diameter; it allows the study of conch shape, ornament and suture line. The conch is extremely discoidal (ww/dm= 0.19) with a wide umbilicus (uw/

Table 37. Conch dimensions (partly estimated) and ratios of the holotype of
Stoyanowites parallelus Korn & Hairapetian
sp. nov. from Baghuk Mountain.
Specimen dm ww wh uw ah ww/dm ww/wh uw/dm WER IZR MB.C.30102 72.2 13.7 22.5 33.7 21.8 0.19 0.61 0.47 2.05 0.03

The suture line of holotype MB.C.30102 shows the short external lobe, which has simple, weakly pouched prongs. The ventrolateral saddle is rather narrow; the adventive and lateral lobes possess six notches ( Fig. 63B ).

Stoyanowites parallelus
sp. nov. differs from
S. dieneri
and
S. aspinosus
in the flat venter and the numerous sharp ventrolateral nodes in the adult stage.
